DSI::TStaticVisitor

TStaticVisitor< ReturnT > Class Template Reference

#include <dsi/TVariant.hpp>

List of all members.

Public Types

typedef ReturnT return_type

Detailed Description

template<typename ReturnT = void>
class DSI::TStaticVisitor< ReturnT >

The static visitor can be used as baseclass for any other objects that should be used to visit a variant object. The derived visitor must implement a corresponding function call operator for any stored type within the variant. An empty function call operator must be provided to handle empty variants.

The function call operators may take non-const references when visiting a non-const variant. Thus, you may modify the variant contents within a visitor. But make sure the signature does match the const modifier of the variant, e.g. visiting a constant variant with a visitor taking non-const references will lead to compilation problems.

The following example creates a visitor which will retrieve the integer value or the length of the stored string within the variant:

 TVariant<int, CHBString> myVar;
 ...
 class CMyVisitor : public TStaticVisitor<int>
 {
 public:
    inline int operator()(int i) const { return i; }
    inline int operator()(const CHBString& str) const { return str.getLength(); }

    inline int operator()() { ... }     
 };

 ...
 printf("The desired value is %d\n", staticVisit(CMyVisitor(), myVar));
